intro: Icacorea duripetala, commonly known as the yellow-flowered iceplant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and succulent stems. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically fleshy and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stems. Icacorea duripetala is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant color and drought-resistant nature.
